Package api.gbuild.component

This package contains the implementation of simple gBuild components the generic definition of one of them, and basic containers.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GComponent
    General definition of a gBuild UI component Since Processing figures are drawn at a specific location and dimension, this class considers a component as the set of 2D/3D primitives or figures located at a position, with an anchor and length, that can be visible or hided for user.
    GImage
    Data type defined by an PImage.
    GPanel
    Component that is a set of components Processing language environment does not include an implementation of a container that store primitives or figures, so it can be difficult to define a set of components that are associated between them.
    GText
    Component defined with a text Processing language evironment does not include an explicit data type for texts, but it offers lots of functions that allows to define properties for texts that will be drawn.

Package api.gbuild.component Description

This package contains the implementation of simple gBuild components the generic definition of one of them, and basic containers.

Talking about gBuild components located here, they are designed to be the basic units on which a complex component is formed. This means that a developer which wants to construct its personal UI component can define it by the use of these components.

Relative to generic definitions and containers, this package includes the abstraction of a gBuild component and the basic implementation of a panel. The first one is defined by its location and dimension, and the great majority of the components extens from it, while the second one is the implementation of a container that is composed by components.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
2.0.1
Author:
